meanings.definition: To make a shrill, grating sound by rubbing body parts together, as certain insects do.
meanings.sent1: The cricket will stridulate by rubbing its wings together.
meanings.sent2: In the quiet night, the cicadas stridulate loudly in the trees.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to have a stridulating competition to see who could make the loudest noise.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the cicadas stridulating filled the air like a chorus of tiny violins.
meanings.sent5: The grasshopper's ability to stridulate is a unique form of communication in the insect world.

meanings.definition: To produce a shrill, grating sound, as certain insects do.
meanings.sent1: The beetle will stridulate when it feels threatened.
meanings.sent2: As the sun set, the grasshoppers began to stridulate in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was interrupted by the unexpected stridulating of a nearby beetle.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the crickets stridulating was like nature's own symphony.
meanings.sent5: The cicadas stridulate to attract mates during the warm summer nights.
